intro: Bartsia laniflora, commonly known as the downy bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of soft hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Bartsia laniflora thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
